title: Who Are the Newly Revealed Jeffrey Epstein Associates ?
body_text:
All these years later, the list of prominent people who were somehow connected to Jeffrey Epstein continues to grow — including some whose ties to the notorious sex trafficker and longtime hobnobber were previously unknown. In 2019, New York published an exhaustive alphabetical list of Epstein’s alleged high-society contacts according to public documents available at the time. Below, we’ve adapted and expanded that list to include the many more names and details that have emerged in the various Epstein files, including his private schedules, his infamous birthday book, the files haphazardly released by the Justice Department under the Epstein Files Transparency Act, and his personal documents, messages, and photographs that have been released by the House Oversight Committee. (Inclusion on this list means only that the person has been somehow linked to Epstein, not that they were necessarily involved in or aware of his crimes.)
We are still updating this guide as we learn more about what’s in the Justice Department’s massive recent file dump. Click these names to skip down to some of the biggest names in the list, as well as some of the entries that have been recently added or expanded: Woody Allen, Steve Bannon, Ehud Barak, Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem, Richard Branson, Deepak Chopra, Andrew Farkas, Bill Gates, Reid Hoffman, Brad Karp, Howard Lutnick, Peter Mandelson, Elon Musk, Kathryn Ruemmler, Peter Thiel, Steve Tisch, Michael Wolff, and Leslie Wexner. Our separate guide to how Donald Trump appears in the Epstein files is here.
Woody Allen: Director
Epstein was longtime friends with Allen and his wife, Soon-Yi Previn. From our 2019 guide:
Epstein kept a photo of his friend Allen, the sexual pariah, on his wall and was photographed walking with him on the Upper East Side. They had more than a neighborhood in common. For years before his relationship with Mia Farrow, Allen had carried on with a 16-year-old girl he’d met at Elaine’s named Babi Christina Engelhardt. In an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, she wondered if she was the inspiration for Manhattan, Allen’s 1979 movie about a man in his 40s who dates a high-school student, which was nominated for two Academy Awards. Engelhardt had sex with Allen more than 100 times, she says, sometimes with Farrow. “The whole thing was a game that was being operated solely by Woody so we never quite knew where we stood,” she said. Engelhardt went on to become Epstein’s assistant.
Documents released by the Justice Department detail Epstein’s extensive relationship with Allen and his wife, Soon-Yi Previn, who sought and received Epstein’s help with their daughters’ educations, and how in 2016, Epstein, at their request, donated $15,000 to the elite K–12 Hewitt School where their teenage daughter Manzie was enrolled.
Anil Ambani: Indian businessman
In 2008, Forbes ranked the Reliance Group chairman, who also briefly served as a member of India’s parliament, as the sixth richest person in the world, but a dramatic business downfall wiped out nearly all of his net worth since then. According to the Justice Department files, Epstein and Ambani first linked up in early 2017 by way of Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem, and soon after Ambani told Epstein that “leadership” wanted to set up meetings with Trump advisers Steve Bannon and Jared Kushner ahead of a possible U.S. visit by Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. They corresponded periodically until months before Epstein’s sex trafficking indictment, discussing world affairs, the Trump administration and the Modi government, and at least a few times, what kind of women Ambani liked. They met in person at least once, in New York in May 2019; Epstein claimed to Bannon that Ambani was someone Modi had sent to talk to him.
Ron Altbach: Keyboardist, co-founder of the rock band King Harvest
Contributor to Epstein’s birthday book.
Charles Althorp: Princess Diana’s brother
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Eva Andersson-Dubin, M.D.: Doctor and former Miss Sweden
Name found on Epstein’s private-jet log.
As our guide noted in 2019:
Epstein’s ex-girlfriend and her husband, billionaire hedge funder Glenn Dubin, had Epstein over for Thanksgiving dinner in 2009, telling his probation officer they were “100 percent comfortable” with his being around their teenage daughter, Insider reported. She also created a foundation so Epstein could donate to her breast-cancer charity without attaching his name. “The Dubins are horrified by the new allegations against Jeffrey Epstein,” they said in a statement. “Had they been aware of the vile and unspeakable conduct described in these new allegations, they would have cut off all ties and certainly never have allowed their children to be in his presence.”
José María Aznar: Former prime minister of Spain
According to FedEx receipts included in the DOJ’s Epstein files, Aznar was the recipient of two packages from Epstein and Maxwell. One, addressed to Aznar and his wife, was sent to their official residence in September 2003 while he was still the Spanish prime minister. The other was sent in May 2004, after Aznar had left office, to him at his think tank. There is no information on the receipts indicating what the packages contained. There is also an October 2003 payment to a travel agent that includes Aznar’s name, but that also could have been Aznar’s son, who shares the same name. The DOJ files include an April 2004 email from Aznar’s son to a redacted recipient that appears to share the address of his father’s think tank. A spokesperson for the former prime minister has said that Aznar doesn’t know what the packages were and that he did not know Epstein.
Vittorio Assaf: Restaurateur
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Peter Attia: Longevity influencer
Documents released by the Justice Department include more than 1,700 mentions of Peter Attia, a physician, a biohacker, and the author of the 2023 best seller Outlive: The Science and Art of Longevity. The documents include appointments and extensive correspondence between Epstein and Attia, including discussions of medical matters and medications. The Cut’s Erica Schwiegershausen reports:
In one email sent to Epstein in February 2016, Attia appeared to write, “Pussy is, indeed, low carb. Still awaiting results on gluten content, though.” If it wasn’t clear just how friendly these two men were, in another 2016 email sent to Epstein’s longtime assistant, Lesley Groff, Attia seems to have written that he hopes to see Epstein soon, adding, “I go into JE withdrawal when I don’t see him” …
In 2015, Epstein emailed Attia a redacted image with the subject line “Got a fresh shipment.” In response, Attia wrote, “The biggest problem with becoming friends with you? The life you lead is so outrageous, and yet I can’t tell a soul.” A year later, Attia wrote, “I need to visit some time” after bringing up “LSJ” — which appears to be a reference to Little Saint James, Epstein’s private island.
In a statement and apology posted to X, Attia acknowledged meeting with Epstein at his Manhattan home as many as eight times but denied that he was his doctor, that he was involved in any criminal activity or sex parties, and that he had been to Epstein’s island. On February 2, Attia resigned from his role as chief science officer at the wellness protein-bar company David.
Joscha Bach: AI researcher
In 2013, Epstein started funding the research of Bach, a German academic who studies artificial intelligence and cognitive science, at MIT Media Lab and Harvard’s Program for Evolutionary Dynamics. Bach is now the executive director of the California Institute for Machine Consciousness. According to the DOJ’s files, Epstein also gave Bach tens of thousands of dollars over the years to help with his family’s living and travel expenses, as well as his kids’ private-school tuition. In one email exchange between him, Epstein, and Noam Chomsky, Bach made some controversial statements about race and gender (which he later disavowed). In a statement to SFGATE, Bach acknowledged that Epstein covered his family’s living costs from 2013 to 2019, but said he had been unaware of any crimes Epstein committed after his 2008 conviction and that Epstein’s money never influenced his research.
Doug Band: Influence peddler
Per our 2019 guide:
A onetime White House intern who climbed his way to being Bill Clinton’s bag carrier, body man, fixer, and all-purpose gatekeeper, Band arranged for the former president to travel to Africa on Epstein’s 727 in 2002. Band would go on to help his boss found the Clinton Global Initiative in 2005, a choice platform from which he launched his own lucrative favor-trading corporate-advisory firm, Teneo. Throughout that time, he took a number of trips on Epstein’s plane and attended parties at his townhouse. Band resigned from his position at CGI in 2012; leaked emails later showed Band and Chelsea Clinton trading accusations of conflicts of interest in a war of influence over her parents. More recently, Band’s been teaching a “Public Service” class at NYU.
André Balazs: Celebrity hotelier
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Alec Baldwin: Actor
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Baldwin has denied knowing Epstein.
Steve Bannon: Trump strategist, MAGA influencer
Bannon and Epstein regularly corresponded in 2018 and 2019, as the Washington Post reports:
Bannon’s phone number and email address are redacted from the newly released files, but the messages include hyperlinks to media appearances and interviews he gave. In one exchange, Epstein suggests that a woman he is connected with will contact the email recipient. The person responds: “Oh ‘the next future ex-mrs. bannon.’” Bannon spent much of spring 2019 in Europe, and Epstein frequently offered to send a private jet or charter a plane to ferry Bannon to meet him in Paris. Bannon appears to have stayed overnight at Epstein’s home in spring 2019, the messages show.
In early 2018, Epstein began referring to Bannon as a friend in emails. Bannon regularly sent him links to his media appearances, and Epstein would offer feedback.
Epstein also had photos of himself and Bannon as well as one of Bannon talking to Woody Allen.
Ehud Barak: Former Israeli prime minister
The longtime Israeli politician had close ties with Epstein, and according to the DOJ-released documents, they corresponded and met up regularly over the last 14 years of Epstein’s life, before and after his sex-offense conviction. Per one analysis, the DOJ documents show Epstein and Barak made arrangements for more than 60 meetings between 2010 and 2019, mostly at Epstein’s Manhattan townhouse, including during the time that Barak was Israel’s defense minister. Barak also stayed at Epstein’s home dozens of times and visited his private Caribbean island.
Donald Barr: Dalton School headmaster
From our 2019 guide:
Barr was ousted shortly before Epstein, 21 and without a college degree, showed up for his first day of work teaching math and physics at the Manhattan’s elite Dalton School in the early 1970s. Barr announced his resignation soon after, in February 1974: “He was disliked by the faculty, he was highly controversial, he hadn’t raised much money, he was very conservative,” said the board’s chairman. Barr’s leadership style was described as “authoritarian” and “undemocratic” at the time. Memorably, several former students told the New York Times that Epstein was overly familiar with teenage girls at the school. Donald’s son William would intersect with Epstein’s orbit while serving as a counsel at Kirkland & Ellis in 2009. The law firm secured Epstein his obscenely lenient 2007 non-prosecution deal, which the Justice Department is now reviewing. In July, Barr the son refused to recuse himself from the ongoing Epstein investigation.
Tom Barrack: Private-equity manager
The staunch Donald Trump ally was friends with Epstein and the former president back when they were close in South Florida in the 1980s. Epstein apparently tried to revive the connection in 2016 after Trump cinched the Republican nomination. In August of that year, Epstein scheduled a lunch with Barrack, who was an informal adviser to the Trump campaign at the time. Barrack was also invited to Epstein’s Upper East Side townhouse in September 2016 with Russian ambassador to the United Nations Vitaly Churkin and Woody Allen.
Sandy Berger: National security adviser for Bill Clinton
Name found on Epstein’s private-jet log.
Nicolas Berggruen: Billionaire investor
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Bill Berkman: New York businessman
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
As we noted in our 2019 guide:
A wealthy executive whose family established the Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Society at Harvard, Berkman was sued in 2014 by his administrative assistant, who said she was forced to read emails Berkman had sent to a colleague containing “pictures of random and unsuspecting women on the street” — that is, creepshots. (The suit was settled.)
Sergey Belyakov: Russian government official
Per a Washington Post analysis of the Justice Department files, Belyakov began cultivating a relationship with Epstein in 2014, when he was serving as Russia’s deputy minister of economic development. They continued to have ties until 2018, apparently meeting in person several times and corresponding about investment opportunities. Belyakov, a graduate of Russia’s Federal Security Services Academy, repeatedly invited Epstein to the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum, which he chaired from 2014–15. The Daily Beast reports that he also helped Epstein obtain Russian visas. Epstein introduced Belyakov to Ehud Barak and tried to arrange for him to meet with Peter Thiel. In 2015, Epstein asked Belyakov for his assistance dealing with “a russian girl from Moscow” who was claiming that “powerful men take advantage of women like her” and was, he said, “attempting to blackmail a group of powerful businessmen in New York.” Belyakov said he would look into the woman and later reported back to Epstein about her. In 2016, while working as an adviser at the Russian Direct Investment Fund, Belyakov sought Epstein’s help attracting foreign investment to Russia.
Mohammed bin Salman: Crown Prince and de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia
Seen in one of Epstein’s photos and is referenced in Epstein’s emails and text messages.
Epstein kept a framed photo of himself and bin Salman on a credenza in his mansion. He also wrote in a 2016 email, following a trip to Saudi Arabia, that MBS, as bin Salman is often referred to as, “sent me a TENT carpets and all.” Before that trip, Epstein’s assistant asked him, “Did you need me to book the Four Seasons for you in Riyadh? Or is the king taking care of it!?”
Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem: CEO of Dubai Port World
The DOJ files reveal that Epstein and bin Sulayem, one of the Dubai’s most prominent businessmen, were longtime friends who corresponded extensively for more than a decade. Bin Sulayem also visited Epstein’s Little Saint James private island multiple times. As the Financial Times and Bloomberg report, business wasn’t the only thing the Emirati executive discussed with Epstein. They also talked about women, including multiple messages bin Sulayem sent describing sexual experiences, that sometimes included images (redacted from the DOJ files). Epstein and bin Sulayem also exchanged emails regarding prostitution, including one in which bin Sulayem appears to explain which sex services he paid for at a Tokyo massage parlor. In one 2017 email chain, bin Sulayem helped arrange for a Russian he described as the “personal masseuse” at Epstein’s “private spa” to work in the spa of a Rixos Hotel in Turkey “so she gains better experiences.”
Epstein arranged or tried to arrange numerous meetings between other associates and bin Sulayem over the years, repeatedly dropped his name in conversations, and he literally used his name in 2016 to purchase a second Caribbean island, Great Saint James, from someone who had refused to sell it to Epstein (because he was a sex offender).
On February 10, Congressman Ro Khanna announced that bin Sulayem was the redacted recipient of an email Epstein sent on April 24, 2009 in which he wrote “where are you? are you ok I loved the torture video.” (This may have been a reference to an ABC News report which Epstein was forwarded that same day about a video showing a member of the UAE’s royal family brutally torturing a man.)
Robin Birley: Nightclub impresario
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Birley owned the club where Meghan Markle and Prince Harry had their first date.
Debonnaire von Bismarck: Countess
Name found in Epstein’s black book — listed as Debbie.
Leopold von Bismarck: Count
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Yes, those Bismarcks.
Vanessa von Bismarck: Heiress and publishing entrepreneur
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Conrad Black: Media mogul
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
From our 2019 guide:
He’s perhaps best known for being sentenced to 42 months in prison for fraud, then writing a book about Trump and receiving a pardon. Vicky Ward, who profiled Epstein for Vanity Fair in 2003, said Epstein heavily leaned on Black, who is her ex-husband’s uncle (and was her ex-husband’s then-boss), to try to exert his influence on Ward.
Leon Black: Apollo Global Management co-founder
The private-equity giant’s relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, whom he paid tens of millions of dollars to, eventually lead to Black stepping down as CEO of Apollo and to his departure from his position as chairman of the Museum of Modern Art. Black contributed a poem to the birthday book. Their emails have also come out, including one in which Epstein writes: “Leon, As you are well aware, There is little I won’t do for you, or at least try to do as a friend, and a great deal that I have already done (both known and some things that will need to remain unknown).” Black has denied having any awareness of Epstein’s crimes.
Roy Black: Epstein lawyer
Per our 2019 guide:
The trial attorney and legal analyst’s client roster has included Justin Bieber, Girls Gone Wild creator Joe Francis, and Rush Limbaugh. Black is perhaps best known for representing William Kennedy Smith against rape charges in Palm Beach in 1991. (The Kennedy nephew was acquitted.) In 2005, Black played the “managing partner” on NBC’s The Law Firm, a knockoff of The Apprentice for up-and-coming lawyers.
David Blaine: Magician
Name found in Epstein’s black book. They also emailed.
Blaine put on a private show for Epstein’s dinner guests in 2003, doing card tricks for the likes of Sergey Brin, Mort Zuckerman, and Bill Clinton aide Doug Band. The dinner was organized by Ghislaine Maxwell and included a group of young women who were introduced as Victoria’s Secret models. Included in the Epstein emails released by the House Oversight Committee is one from Blaine supporting a visa application for an “amazing fashion model.”
Tony Blair: Former British prime minister
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Henry Blodget: Founder of Business Insider
As Semafor reports, the Justice Department files include a 2013 email chain showing correspondence between Epstein’s philanthropic foundation and Blodget in which they asked for BI to take down a mugshot of Epstein it had published, arguing that it “undermines the foundation’s work which funds critical science and medical research.” Blodget then forwarded the email to a BI editor who swapped the mugshot for another photo. (He told Semafor he did not remember that but emphasized that “We published hundreds of tough stories on him.”) This was part of an effort by a team Epstein hired to scrub the internet of negative press about him.
Michael Bloomberg: Billionaire and former mayor of New York
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Todd Boehly: Chairman of Chelsea FC
According to the DOJ files, Epstein arranged two meetings with Boehly in 2011, when he was a managing partner at Guggenheim Partners. Boehly is also now a part owner of the Los Angles Dodgers and Lakers.
Hassanal Bolkiah: Sultan of Brunei
As we noted in our 2019 guide:
Epstein had at least one meeting with the sultan when he traveled to Brunei in 2002 with Bill Clinton. Bolkiah and his brother are famous for their lavish spending, including a collection of 2,500 cars and a $1.5 billion palace. Bolkiah was once sued by Miss USA 1997, who claimed she had been held as a sex slave. The suit was dismissed on the grounds that Bolkiah had sovereign immunity.
Annabelle Bond: British socialite
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Andrea Bonomi: Italian businessman
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
The chairman and founder of Investindustrial was a key character in the Paradise Papers international tax-shelter scandal.
Michael Borrico: Long Island contractor
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Described by Social Life magazine as the “ambassador of the all-important Hamptons polo culture,” Borrico is known for hosting polo matches at his estate in Water Mill.
Leon Botstein: President of Bard College
Epstein’s private schedules from 2013 to 2017 had roughly two dozen meetings scheduled with Botstein over the four years covered in the documents, mostly at his townhouse. Regarding his relationship with Epstein, Botstein told The Wall Street Journal he was interested only in Epstein’s money: “I was an unsuccessful fundraiser and actually the object of a little bit of sadism on his part in dangling philanthropic support.”
Frederic Bourke: A founder of Dooney & Bourke
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Bourke went to prison for a scheme to bribe government officials in Azerbaijan.
Hamish Bowles: European editor-at-large for Vogue
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Muriel Brandolini: Interior designer
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Her clients have included Matt Lauer and the crown prince and princess of Greece.
Richard Branson: Founder of Virgin Group
Branson has his own private island in the British Virgin Islands, and he hosted Epstein there three times in 2013. According to emails included in the DOJ documents, before one trip Epstein said he would need U.K. visas for “2 Russian girls.” After another visit, Epstein emailed Branson to thank him for his hospitality, and Branson replied, “Any time you’re in the area would love to see you. As long as you bring your harem!” (According to a Virgin Group representative, Epstein had brought three women with him to the island and referred to them as his “harem.”) The British billionaire also offered Epstein some PR advice about getting Bill Gates to vouch for his reformation:
I think if Bill Gates was willing to say that you’ve been a brilliant advisor to him, that you slipped up many years ago by sleeping with a 17 ½ year old woman and were punished for it, that you’ve more than learnt your lesson and have done nothing that’s against the law since and, yes, as a single man you seem to have a penchant for women. But there’s nothing wrong with that.
The DOJ documents include two photos of Epstein and Branson in an unidentified tropical location. Epstein kept one of the images framed on the wall of his Manhattan townhouse.
Epstein also offered Branson a $50,000 donation in October 2013. A Virgin Group representative told the Financial Times that any contact Branson and his wife had with Epstein “was limited to group or business settings.” They also said that after Epstein offered his donation, a due-diligence check “uncovered serious allegations” and the company’s charitable foundation Virgin Unite didn’t take the donation, and the Bransons “decided not to meet or speak with Epstein again.” (Per the emails released by the DOJ, Epstein instead donated the money to WildAid, where Branson serves as a brand ambassador, at the request of Virgin Unite’s CEO.)
Børge Brende: President and CEO of World Economic Forum
Brende, who is also the former foreign minister of Norway, visited Epstein’s Manhattan townhouse once in 2018 and twice in 2019, and he also corresponded with Epstein via email and text. Brende says the visits were all multi-person business dinners, that he attended the first at the invitation of Norwegian diplomat Terje Rød-Larsen, and that he was “completely unaware of Epstein’s past and criminal activities.”
Flavio Briatore: Italian millionaire businessman
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
A friend of Trump, a convicted card cheat, and an accused Formula 1 race fixer, Briatore was a longtime fugitive in the Virgin Islands.
Sergey Brin: Google co-founder
According to a court filing, Epstein advised Brin from 2004 to 2007, including providing guidance on how to set up a tax shelter — a tax-saving trust for Brin’s kids called a grantor-retained annuity trust — with bankers at JPMorgan Chase. Brin had become a client of the bank in 2004 following a referral from Epstein and subsequently held more than $4 billion in accounts there. The Wall Street Journal notes that Epstein helped billionaire and Apollo Global Management co-founder Leon Black set up a similar tax shelter. Epstein’s relationship with Brin came to light in an August 2023 court filing by the U.S. Virgin Islands in its civil suit against JPMorgan over the bank’s relationship with Epstein. Documents released by the Justice Department include an undated photo of Brin and at least three redacted women at some tropical location, as well as a report from one of Epstein’s accusers that Brin and his wife at the time spent a day on Epstein’s island in January 2007.
John Brockman: Literary agent
Name found on Epstein’s private-jet log.
David Brooks: Journalist
Images obtained from the Epstein estate and released by the House Oversight Committee show the New York Times columnist at a 2011 “billionaire’s dinner” attended by Epstein, Sergy Brin, and numerous other business leaders. A Times spokesperson said it was a “widely-attended dinner” and Brooks had no other contact with Epstein.
Edgar Bronfman Jr.: Executive
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
The former Warner Music Group CEO, son of the late Seagram’s CEO Edgar Bronfman Sr., is related to the NXIVM-sex-cult Bronfmans. His son has a child with singer-rapper M.I.A.
Jean-Luc Brunel: Model scout
Name found in Epstein’s black book and on Epstein’s private-jet log. He also contributed to Epstein’s birthday book.
Per our 2019 guide:
Brunel was accused in court testimony of having used his agency to supply Epstein with girls. (He was not charged.) He also has a long history of allegations that he had abused his fashion-world position. In 1988, he was the subject of a 60 Minutes investigation alleging that he and a fellow agent sexually assaulted nearly two dozen models. He denied the claims but later told Model author Michael Gross, “You get laid tonight with a model, is that a crime?” In 2005, Brunel co-founded the MC2 modeling agency; Epstein invested $1 million, according to a 2010 deposition.
Brunel killed himself in 2022 while in a Paris jail awaiting trial on charges of raping and trafficking minors.
Joan Juliet Buck: Fashion editor
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
As we noted in our 2019 guide:
In 2003, Buck met Maxwell at a fashion party at a New York City boutique. Buck had recently moved on from her seven-year tenure as the editor of French Vogue and was writing for its American counterpart and living in New Mexico. She was a lifelong resident of a rarefied social world. Maxwell, a regular on that particular circuit, quickly made a connection. “Oh, Jeffrey’s got a ranch in Santa Fe, blah blah blah,” Buck recently remembered their conversation going. She gave Maxwell her Santa Fe number and later asked a friend about Epstein and New Mexico. “His ranch?” the friend replied. “As we say in Texas, all hat, no cattle.”
Ron Burkle: Supermarket magnate
Name found in Epstein’s black book and on Epstein’s private-jet log.
Burkle took what were described as humanitarian trips to Africa with Bill Clinton on Epstein’s private Boeing 727. According to a 2008 Vanity Fair feature about former president Clinton, “Burkle’s usual means of transport is the custom-converted Boeing 757 that Clinton calls ‘Ron Air’ and that Burkle’s own circle of young aides privately refer to as ‘Air Fuck One.’ ”
William Burns, former CIA director
According to his private documents, Epstein had three scheduled meetings in 2014 with Burns, who was at that point the deputy secretary of State during the Obama administration. They met both in Washington, D.C., and New York.
Candace Bushnell: Columnist who inspired Sex and the City
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Arpad Busson: French financier
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Per our 2019 guide:
During a custody battle with ex Uma Thurman, Thurman’s lawyer asked Busson, a prominent hedge funder, if he had ever said he was “addicted to prostitutes.” (He said no.)
Jason Calacanis: Businessman
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
An investor in Uber, Calacanis was a fixture in the early aughts New York tech scene as the founder and editor of Silicon Alley Reporter. (“I can’t tell you how many propositions I get, it’s absolutely insane,” he told the Observer in 2000.) In 2014, Vice awarded him Most Offensive Tweet of the Year for describing as racist the idea of white privilege.
Nicky Caledon: Earl
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Naomi Campbell: Supermodel
Name found in Epstein’s black book and on Epstein’s private-jet log.
The Wall Street Journal reports that the model’s name was in Epstein’s schedules after 2008, and that one of Epstein’s accusers said that she was approached by an Epstein associate at a 2010 Campbell event in Paris and told that Epstein knew Campbell and could help her modeling career.
Nicholas and Christian Candy: British property-developer brothers
Names found in Epstein’s black book.
Graydon Carter: Former editor of Vanity Fair
According to journalist Vicky Ward, he killed portions of a 2003 story that accused Epstein of pedophilia after an office visit from Epstein. (Carter says there wasn’t enough on-the-record sourcing.) “I didn’t invent the system. I just lived by the system,” he said when The New York Times Magazine questioned him about it.
Fidel Castro: Former president of Cuba
Appears in a group photo with Epstein that the financier displayed in his mansion.
James Cayne: Bear Stearns CEO
Contributor to Epstein’s birthday book.
Aurelia Cecil: PR chairwoman
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Allegedly the former girlfriend of Prince Andrew.
Mark Cecil: Hedge funder
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
Has hosted Prince William and Kate Middleton at his villa in Mustique.
Vikram Chatwal: Hotelier
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
When 1990s playboy Chatwal settled down, Bill Clinton attended his wedding. In 2017, Chatwal pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor violation after being accused of trying to set a pair of dogs on fire on a Soho street.
Noam Chomsky: Linguist and author
According to Epstein’s schedules he arranged several meetings with Chomsky in 2015 and 2016, who was then teaching at MIT where Epstein had donated hundreds of thousands of dollars. The scheduled meetings included a gathering of academics as well as a flight with Epstein aboard his private jet to New York for a dinner at his townhouse with film director Woody Allen and his wife, Soon-Yi Previn. Chomsky and Epstein also corresponded about news and politics via email between 2015 and 2017.
Deepak Chopra: New Age author
Epstein and Chopra corresponded repeatedly and met up at least 12 times between 2016 and 2019, including dinners at Epstein’s Manhattan townhouse and funding meetings regarding alternative medicine. In one email exchange, Chopra asked whether a woman had dropped civil charges against Epstein and replied “good” when Epstein said she had. In another exchange, they traded jokes about “cute girls.” In other correspondence, they made apparently metaphorical references to “the tiger,” and in one email, Chopra told Epstein that he was “deeply grateful for our friendship.” He also asked Epstein for financial advice. In a statement on February 4, Chopra said that while some of his messages to Epstein “reflect poor judgment in tone,” he insisted that “I was never involved in, nor did I participate in, any criminal or exploitative conduct.”
Vitaly Churkin: Russia’s ambassador to the United Nations
The Justice Department files include messages between Epstein and Churkin, who died in 2017, indicating that in the summer of 2016, Epstein helped his son Maxim find a job in the U.S. Epstein said “Any maxim help is confidential” and Churkin replied “Of course.” He also told Epstein, regarding his son, that “U r a great teacher!” Epstein also indicated to Thorbjørn Jagland in a 2018 email that he had advised Churkin about how to deal with Trump.
The DOJ files also include correspondence and arranged meetings between Epstein and Maxim Churkin.
Giuseppe Cipriani: Restaurant magnate
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
The scene-y Cipriani Italian spots are known for inventing the Bellini cocktail — and more infamously for being Harvey Weinstein’s “hunting ground.”
Gustavo Cisneros: Venezuelan billionaire
Name found in Epstein’s black book.
The patriarch of a family so wealthy it operates practically as its own nation-state in Latin America.
Bill Clinton: Former U.S. president
Name found on Epstein’s private-jet log. Seen in numerous photos included in the Justice Department’s Epstein files.
From Rebecca Traister’s entry on Clinton in our 2019 guide:
As soon as the Epstein news broke two weeks ago, the taunting and tallying began, suffocating in its familiarity. First were the jeering reminders, as if we didn’t know it in our every molecule: It wasn’t just Donald Trump who’d be ensnared in this stygian nightmare of underage sexual assault and trafficking of girls, it was Bill Clinton, who’d been a friend and repeat flier on Epstein’s plane. Then came the numbers, the attempts to quantify the nature of the Clinton-Epstein relationship. Clinton issued a statement toting up four plane trips, one Epstein meeting in Clinton’s Harlem office, one visit to Epstein’s home, and zero trips to his island. There are currently 475 level-three sex offenders registered in New York County, but in 2011, when an attorney from the office of Cy Vance, Manhattan DA, argued that Epstein’s risk level should be reduced, Justice Ruth Pickholz responded, “I have to tell you I am a little overwhelmed because I have never seen a prosecutor’s office do anything like this.” Pickholz denied the request — Epstein’s risk assessment put him 20 points above the required threshold for the highest level of offender — and the DA’s office later reversed its request. Though there’s no indication Vance and Epstein were friendly, his office has been criticized previously for declining to pursue sex-crimes charges against Harvey Weinstein that coincided with a donation from his attorneys (though Weinstein has since been charged by Vance’s office) and fraud charges against Ivanka and Donald Trump Jr.

Leslie Wexner: Billionaire retail magnate
Name found in Epstein’s black book, contributor to Epstein’s birthday book.
Wrote Michelle Celarier and Carl Swanson in our 2019 guide:
Retailing billionaire Leslie Wexner was Epstein’s only known client, the man who transferred the rights to that famous townhouse to him for free in 2011, years after they were supposed to no longer be in contact. The relationship stretches back to the late 1980s, a time when Wexner’s star was on the rise. A 1985 cover story for New York visited him in Columbus, Ohio, where his retail empire was built. Journalist Julie Baumgold described how he, not unlike Epstein, was a self-made man, addicted to self-improvement, how he didn’t know how to pronounce La Grenouille correctly and wanted to have his picture taken at the Whitney, and noted that “Wexner is what used to be known as a ‘confirmed bachelor.’ ” (He later married and has four children.) Not long after that piece, he was introduced to Epstein, who had left Bear Stearns under a cloud and was broke. He and Wexner hit it off, and Epstein soon began managing Wexner’s finances. Wexner’s credibility lent plausibility to the notion that Epstein managed billions from his Caribbean-island redoubt. Associates of Wexner, who is now worth $6.6 billion, didn’t understand the attraction. Soon after the men began working together, Epstein moved into Wexner’s Upper East Side mansion. Wexner bought the seven-story townhouse in 1989 for $13.2 million but apparently lived there only for a few months. The title was transferred in 2011 to a Virgin Islands entity controlled by Epstein. It is now worth $56 million.

According to the Justice Department files, Zeitlin and Epstein were introduced in early 2018 by Steve Bannon, who called Zeitlin a “close friend.” They then corresponded periodically for more than a year and also met up in person. In some of their email exchanges, they discussed Trump administration diplomacy and foreign business opportunities, and Epstein linked Zeitlin up with DP World CEO Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem and others. In 2019, Zeitlin met with an Epstein associate about a possible job at Tapestry (the parent company Coach and Kate Spade New York), apparently at Epstein’s request. The associate’s name is redacted from the files.
Zeitlin resigned from his role leading Tapestry in 2020 after a reporter dug into allegations that he had once used an alias to moonlight as a fashion photographer, took photos of multiple women, some of which were sexually suggestive, and had a consensual extramarital affair with one of the models.

Emails in the Justice Department documents indicate Epstein and Zuckerberg met at least once, at an August 2015 dinner with several other tech CEOs hosted by Reid Hoffman. Days after the dinner, Hoffman connected Epstein and Zuckerberg via email “so that convo can continue,” but so far there’s no indication they ever corresponded, or that Zuckerberg had any other association with him.

Zuckerman went into business with Epstein — briefly — in 2004, spending $25 million to invest in Radar, but he pulled the plug after just three issues. He first attempted a deal with Epstein in 2003, when he was part of a consortium with Michael Wolff, Donny Deutsch, Nelson Peltz, and Harvey Weinstein to buy New York Magazine. Zuckerman also contributed a satirical letter to Epstein’s birthday book.
